name: LangGraph State Management Patterns
title: LangGraph State Management Patterns
description: Patterns for managing state in LangGraph workflows including TypedDict schemas, reducers, checkpointing, and interrupt points

axiomAlignment.A1_verifiability: State schemas and checkpointing enable verifiable workflow execution and recovery
axiomAlignment.A2_user_primacy: Thread isolation and partial updates preserve user workflow context
axiomAlignment.A3_transparency: Explicit reducers and state schemas make accumulation behavior traceable
axiomAlignment.A4_non_harm: Proper reducer usage and state validation prevent data corruption
axiomAlignment.A5_consistency: Unified state patterns across LangGraph workflows ensure predictable behavior

Validate implementation against domain requirements before deployment
Define clear state schemas with TypedDict to enable type checking and IDE autocomplete, improving code reliability
Use appropriate reducers (add_messages, operator.add, custom reducers) for each state field to ensure correct accumulation behavior
Implement checkpointing for production workflows using Redis or PostgreSQL backends to enable workflow resumption and recovery
Use unique thread IDs in config.configurable for multi-user scenarios to isolate state and prevent cross-contamination
Clean up old checkpoints periodically using TTL or scheduled cleanup jobs to prevent storage bloat and reduce costs
Return partial state updates from nodes (only fields that changed) rather than full state to improve performance and reduce conflicts
Use interrupt_before and interrupt_after for human-in-the-loop checkpoints at critical decision points in workflows
Validate state schema consistency across workflow versions to prevent runtime errors from schema mismatches

anti_patterns.name: Mutable state
anti_patterns.problem: Directly mutating state objects causes side effects, race conditions, and makes debugging difficult
anti_patterns.solution: Always return new state dictionaries from nodes, never mutate existing state objects directly

anti_patterns.name: No checkpointing
anti_patterns.problem: Workflows cannot be resumed after failures or interruptions, losing progress and requiring full restart
anti_patterns.solution: Add MemorySaver for development or Redis/PostgreSQL checkpointers for production to enable state persistence

anti_patterns.name: Missing reducers
anti_patterns.problem: State fields without reducers default to replacement behavior, losing accumulated data when multiple nodes update the same field
anti_patterns.solution: Define Annotated types with appropriate reducers (add_messages for lists, operator.add for numbers) for all accumulating fields

anti_patterns.name: Reusing thread IDs
anti_patterns.problem: Reusing thread IDs across different workflows or users causes state contamination and incorrect behavior
anti_patterns.solution: Generate unique thread IDs per workflow instance or user session, use UUIDs or composite keys (user_id:session_id)

anti_patterns.name: Returning full state
anti_patterns.problem: Returning complete state from nodes overwrites unchanged fields unnecessarily, causing performance issues and potential conflicts
anti_patterns.solution: Return only fields that changed in partial state updates, letting LangGraph merge with existing state using reducers
